name: Richard CARTER, For the Incarcerated Citizens' Congress, Appellant, v. Tom RIDGE, Governor of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Stewart J. Greenleaf, Senator/Chairman of the Pennsylvania Senate Judiciary Committee, and, Michael R. Hackman, Associate Director of the Pennsylvania Prison Society, Appellees

parties: Richard CARTER, For the Incarcerated Citizens’ Congress, Appellant, v. Tom RIDGE, Governor of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Stewart J. Greenleaf, Senator/Chairman of the Pennsylvania Senate Judiciary Committee, and, Michael R. Hackman, Associate Director of the Pennsylvania Prison Society, Appellees.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 20th day of August, 1997, the order of the Commonwealth Court is affirmed.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
699 A.2d 727
Richard CARTER, For the Incarcerated Citizens’ Congress, Appellant, v. Tom RIDGE, Governor of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Stewart J. Greenleaf, Senator/Chairman of the Pennsylvania Senate Judiciary Committee, and, Michael R. Hackman, Associate Director of the Pennsylvania Prison Society, Appellees.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Aug. 20, 1997.
Reargument Denied Oct. 23, 1997.
